We are all about Playing with Learning Kids learning to code Learning with Informing parents about Having fun in Minecraft !!

Welcome to the Belgium Minecraft Family

We would like to take this opportunity to invite you, your kids and your family to come and meet, play, know each other or learn to code in the Minecraft universe. Maybe you are just curious and want to come and see what it is. Ever wonder what your kids are playing? Or you do know and want to learn more or share your knowledge?

@Meetup Event:

  1. the kids can all jump on a communal Minecraft server (if they like) and play Minecraft together.
  2. Our kids can meet new friends in person,
  3. We can coordinate games, play-dates, and servers.
  4. can meet and share tips and challenges in supporting our kids playing Minecraft.
  5. And help each other learn the many ways of Minecraft, mods, servers, coding .

Bring your laptop or tablet with a genuine version of Minecraft when you want to play. Or bring your laptop for Java related questions.

This is a family friendly Minecraft event.

That means all Minecraft fans are welcome, but minors are requested to be accompanies by an adult guardian.

Register at: Meetup.com/Belgium-Minecraft-Family

  • Family Event

    That means all Minecraft fans are welcome, but minors are requested to be accompanies by an adult.

  • Meetup Server

    the kids can all jump on a communal Minecraft server (if they like) and play Minecraft together.

  • Strategy

    The end goal is learning kids to Code, but the road trip to get there will include a lot of fun

  • Event Locations

    We will always do our best to find a location that is easy accessible for everybody.

Longtime goals

Another aspect of Minecraft is the small step it takes to programming. Letting kids increase the strength of an explosion with Java in Minecraft gives them an instant result. Learn to code is much more satisfying if you can tamper with videogames.

  1. Regular Meetups
  2. Let kids meet other kids
  3. Adult meet other adults
  4. Run managed servers for kids and adults
  5. Minecraft Competition
  6. Learn kids to code
  7. Learns them insights about how to create.
  8. They can re-create real electrical circuits with Redstone or create a computer to do calculations.

Register at: Meetup.com/Belgium-Minecraft-Family
